answers.answer: I have not noticed a big change in weight yet but have only finished treatment a week ago. When I think about it my weight has remained amazingly the same since I started treatment a year ago (175 pounds given or taken 2 or 3). I think you should rejoice if the TX reduced yours and keeps doing that to you gradually. Loosing pounds will help you in every of the areas you described: diabete; cardiovascular system, blood pressure, joints, mobility, etc...

Hi Bud! Glad to hear you are doing well.  I had lost about 55 lbs during tx & I love it, but what bothered me was the slightly baggy skin I was left with. (especially in my thighs & tummy area)I have gained 4 lbs in the past month, but I actually WANTED to gain a few lbs to see if it would help "fill me out" again.  It has worked and I do look better.  I'm really going to try to keep myself at my current weight, because I feel really limber and comfortable. Friends & family are all telling me that I look wonderful.  Now the work starts to maintain my diet and exercise routines.My stomach shrunk during tx, and I am still eating much smaller portions so my stomach doesn't stretch larger.  I usually get full by eating half a regular adult portion.  I'm a really cheap date! LOLIt feels good to be able to be in the sun again and to do yard work. I still get little dizzy spells occasionally, but I figure that's just the meds which are probably still wearing off.Have a good one!-E

I like Lady E alsot lost 55 pounds during tx.  5 of it I lost the month after tx.  I'm 5 months post now and the weight loss seems to have stabalized.  I was also left with the baggy skin in the thights, tummy, arms and I also now sport a turkey waddle under my neck.   I would rather not put the weight back on.So, in essence, your weight should eventually stabalize.   In a couple of months if you continue to lose and are eating normally then I'd ask your doc to look in to it.Mousegenotype 1a, Stage 3, Grade 3Finished 48 weeks of tx on 4/13/07Hoping for SVR on September 20, 2007

I am still on treatment  37/48 and have lost 88 lbs so far.    I wanted to comment on the Type II diabetes.     I developed Type II diabetes after going thru treatment 14 years ago.    2 weeks ago, I had some tests run, one of which was my A1C, since losing so much, I stopped taking my amaryl a few months back.  Well my level was Excellent  4.2  which is the low end of normal 4.2 - 6.  So losing the weight may help with that.  The only thing out of normal range was my triclyceredes.  Which I do not understand, as I hardly eat anything.  Maybe my body is storing what I do get in Fat, because my body thinks its starving ?I am hoping to keep it off after treatment as well.  Like lady E the loose skin is not something we want, but better than the fat content..
I'm jealous, didn't lose on tx, having to work not to gain now.....can't complain of the loose skin though, mine is stretched nicely over my frame:)Bug

question: During my 48 week tx I lost 30 lbs, from 270 ( my highest weight ever ) down to 240. Right now I'm weighing in at 233 or so. I'm not doing anything in particular to lose the weight. A little more work outside. Maybe it's the additional energy/metabolism.Also, before my tx I was what was called borderline type II diabetic. I've noticed that now, even after a large meal, my blood sugar comes down relatively quickly to the proper number 105-110 within about an hour. I was worried about his because I've been having some bouts of dizziness lately. Not fatigue per say,  more of a lightheadedness. More common late at night. I find myself sleeping less as well but all in all I feel pretty good. IT may be the weening off the anti-d's.Also, my blood pressure has been really easy to keep down these days. As usual, I always have a problem with the systolic being high and if I medicate to get that down, the dystolic(sp) gets really low but this AM I was right at 130/75 which is pretty darn good.Anyway, anyone else continue to lose weight after tx ?  I thought I'd blow up like a balloon but that hasn't been the case.
title: Still losing weight 1 month post tx
